H0.text: The collection of waste material is the process that most controls the passage of oxygen into and out of capillaries, whose walls are only one layer of cells thick.

H1.text: Breakdown of materials is the process that controls the passage of oxygen into and out of the capillaries, given that capillary walls are only one layer of cells thick.

H2.text: Diffusion of material is the process that controls the passage of oxygen into and out of capillaries, whose walls are only one cell layer thick.

H3.text: Storage of materials is the process that most controls the passage of oxygen into and out of capillaries, which are only one layer of cells thick.

A4.text: Molecules smaller than 3 nm such as water and gases cross the capillary wall through the space between cells in a process known as paracellular transport.

A5.text: Other substances which cross capillaries include water, oxygen, carbon dioxide, urea, glucose, uric acid, lactic acid and creatinine.
